intro: Asarum savatieri subsp. pseudosavatieri, commonly known as the Vietnamese wild ginger, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, reddish-brown flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. The subspecies is closely related to other members of the Aristolochiaceae family, sharing similar morphological and chemical characteristics.
